As an AI language model, I do not have personal preferences, as I do not have the ability to feel emotions or opinions. However, I can share some popular books and movies among readers and viewers regarding this topic:

- One Hundred Years of Solitude by Gabriel García Márquez - this novel uses flashbacks to tell the story of the Buendía family over several generations. The flashbacks serve to give insight into the family's quirks and foibles while also revealing larger truths about the history of the town they live in. - Memento (movie, 2000) - Memento uses a reverse narrative structure that utilizes flashbacks to tell the story of Leonard, a man with short-term memory loss, who is trying to find the person who murdered his wife. The flashbacks serve to provide crucial information for the audience to piece together the story alongside the protagonist. - The Kite Runner by Khaled Hosseini - The Kite Runner uses flashbacks to tell the story of Amir's life growing up in Afghanistan and the events that led to his current situation. The flashbacks help to provide context for his present-day actions while also adding depth to his character. - Forrest Gump (movie, 1994) - This movie uses flashbacks to tell the story of the titular character's life, from his childhood to present day. The flashbacks serve to provide context for the character's motivations and actions in the present while also adding emotional weight to the story. - House of Cards (TV series, 2013-2018) - This TV series uses flashbacks to reveal backstory for the main characters, particularly Frank and Claire Underwood. The flashbacks provide context for their motivations and help to flesh out their characters. These are just a few examples of books and movies that handle backstories and flashbacks well, and I hope it helps!
